p: For each baseline cultivar three crop maturity durations were identified for developing virtual cultivars – baseline (no change in the GCs), 10% shorter and 10% longer maturity cultivars. The procedure for making changes in crop maturity duration has been described in Singh et al. (2014c). To increase the yield potential of cultivars, the coefficients G1, G4 and GT in the cultivar file and radiation use efficiency (RUE) in the ecotype file (*.ECO) were increased by 10% each. These procedures resulted in six virtual cultivars, namely, baseline, 10% short, 10% long, baseline + yield potential, 10% short + yield potential and 10% long + yield potential, to which the drought and heat tolerance traits were incorporated virtually.
